itemDescription: Scottish suffragette and journalist. Honorary secretary of the Aberdeen branch of the Women's Social and Political Union (WSPU)

wikipedia_page.main: Caroline Phillips (1874 – 13 January 1956) was a Scottish feminist, suffragette and journalist. She was honorary secretary of the Aberdeen branch of the Women's Social and Political Union (WSPU), met and corresponded with many of the leaders of the movement and was also involved in the organisation of militant action in Aberdeen.

response: *Caroline Phillips Scottish suffragette and journalist, who owned Banchory Station Hotel 1912 to 1940s
